intro: Colysis samarense, commonly known as the Samarensis Caper, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Capparaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and fleshy, edible fruits. The plant typically grows in humid, tropical environments and thrives in well-drained soil. Its leaves are simple and alternate, often with a slightly waxy texture. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
